page.title: 01BARNARD CASTLE IN TEESDALE
page.content: Barnard Castle is a small market town in Co.Durham (pop.approx.5000).It is the historic centre of Teesdale and stands on the River Tees.It is near Darlington and Scotch corner in an area of scenic beauty.The town has grown around the 12th century castle built by Bernard Baliol,from which it takes its name.The countryside around it is mainly farmland.Though small , Barnard Castle is the centre of activity in the area,but has limited amenities.Its attraction is its natural beauty,historic interests and quiet lifestyle.Glaxo laboratories provides work for many families,others are in farming or cater for tourists, many of whom come to see Bowes Museum. About 2km N.E.of the town is the small village of Stainton,South of which is the housing estate of Stainton Grove, once army married quarters.
